content:
Clara said
I can ask a question on this Forum but can't access Answers. What to do?

Are you asking how to post a reply to a thread that is not locked?. If so then scroll down to the Post a Reply box then type in your reply then click on the [Post Reply].

To find the threads and replies you have posted in future you can look at top right for your name, hover over your name and either click on My Questions for your threads or click on View Profile to search for any threads/replies you have made.
creator: James

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: The accounts on each need to be IMAP. If one is POP and the other is IMAP, it cannot be done. Also, you cannot change an account from POP to IMAP, but must set up a new account.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks for your answer. Both accounts are POP. In fact it's the exact same account. Surely I should be able to synchronize the Sent folder on both devices? Thanks for any further help.
creator: shardstrat

content: No. The sent folder is separate for each. Cannot be done.
creator: davidsk

content: POP is only for receiving e-mail. To send you probably use SMTP. SMTP typically doesn't cause the e-mail to appear in the remote server. Regardless, it's abnormal to make e-mail available to POP server that was sent through SMTP.
creator: brunoais

content: To clarify, SMTP is only for sending and is not related to POP or IMAP.

content: The first question was, why thunderbird have deleted most emails between 2008 and 2023. To restore emails do not help very much if thunderbird will later delete them.
creator: kent.lennartsson

content:
kent.lennartsson said
The first question was, why thunderbird have deleted most emails between 2008 and 2023.

Is each year's data saved in a different folder? (that would probably be best) Do any have retention values set in Properties > Retention Settings?

After the fact, typically impossible to say why it was lost, much less will it happen again in the future. But losses of this type and magnitude tend to be something on the local computer - anvirus SW, bad disk, etc. In those cases, typically an entire folder of messages is lost.

Check https://mzl.la/4jo2vJ2 to see if any are a solid match.

content: This seems to be the easiest way: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder - back up one folder - you are now at .. appdata\roaming\thunderbird\profiles\<profile name> - exit thunderbird now (VERY IMPORTANT) - copy the profile to external media - start thunderbird on linux - click tools>import>import from another thunderbird installation - click 'choose a profile folder' - select your exported proflle and install

content:
Je možné, že ten priečinok je už preplnený. Thunderbirdom je stanovený maximálny objem 4GB (rovnako ako aj pre každý samostatný priečinok). Kliknite na ten priečinok pravým tlačidlom myši, vyberte "Vlastnosti" a preverte akú veľkosť na disku zaberá. Limit veľkosti zložky je detailnejšie vysvetlený tuná: http://kb.mozillazine.org/Limits_%28Thunderbird%29#Folders_and_messages.

Odporúčam staré správy z tohoto preplneného priečinka odstrániť, alebo archivovať.

content:
Děkuji za radu, složka zabírá 3,0MB je to nová instalace. Ale přišel jsem na zvláštní věc, v místních složkách mám podsložku s názvem "firemní" a v této složce uložené emaily jsou vidět pouze řádkový výpis ale nelze je číst ani otevřít příloha pokud je připojena. Když jsem tuto podsložku přejmenoval např. "aaa" nebo "bbb" nebo "pokus" tak se emaily zaktivní a je vidět text a lze otevřít i příloha. Po přejmenování zpět na "firemní" se to vrátí do původního stavu a je vidět pouze řádkový soupis emailů, ale neukáže se text ani příloha.

Děkuji Pavel

content: If all the data are in the accounts, my suggestion is to do a full uninstall. You can download from thunderbird.net and if you have install problems, please post so we can assist. We can then assist in helping sign up for the gmail accounts. IF you had messages in a POP account on Local Folders, I suggest the first thing to do is to copy the profile to another place to prevent any further loss. Let us know when you're ready to continue. (TIP: after installing, go to settings>general and set thunderbird to notify you of updates, but NOT to automatically install them. That keeps you in charge.)

content:
I share your concerns. To guarantee accessibility, exporting each message to EML may be best, but mbox format is more convenient as that contains all messages in a folder. One way to be sure of your backups is to use a free mbox viewer, such as the one at https://sourceforge.net/projects/mbox-viewer/ - It just unzips, not install. Some of the messages are clumsy, but it lets you see all messages outside of Thunderbird dependency. There are several free viewers, and here is a slightly fancier one: https://www.freeviewer.org/mbox/ The mbox files with thunderbird usually have an accompanying file with msf suffix. You can ignore those, as they are just indexes.

On that, I always do backups with the intent of being able to easily move to another PC or do a full reinstall. To do that with Thunderbird, here are steps that do work:


BACKUP

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media

RESTORE

  1. ensure thunderbird is installed and NOT running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  4. start thunderbird and all should be there

This backs up the data, and also all the settings for thunderbird and accounts for a much easier move between computers. For me, this has never failed. And I do it every couple of weeks to avoid total loss.
creator: davidsk
